text:
I am creating a jar thus:

<jar jarfile="${lib.dir}/${jar.name}"
     index="true"
     filesonly="true"
     basedir="${build.dir}">
  <manifest>
    <attribute name="main-class" value="${mainpackage}.Main" />
  </manifest>
</jar>

My jar is created properly with the manifest specified inline.  However, I also 
receive this warning message:

[jar] File D:\larva\build\META-INF\MANIFEST.MF includes a META-INF/MANIFEST.MF 
which will be ignored. To include this file, set filesetManifest to a value 
other than 'skip'.

The manifest file to which the above warning refers is present, but was not 
created by me.  This is just an annoyance, but I would be reluctant to have 
anyone else build my project knowing they would receive a perplexing message.
creator: mbenson@apache.org
umagesh@apache.org
text:
This has been fixed and the misleading message will not appear when 1.5.1 is
released.
